info.title: Train Travel API
info.description:
API for finding and booking train trips across Europe.

## Run in Postman

Experiment with this API in Postman, using our Postman Collection.

[![Run In Postman](https://run.pstmn.io/button.svg =128pxx32px)](https://app.getpostman.com/run-collection/9265903-7a75a0d0-b108-4436-ba54-c6139698dc08?action=collection%2Ffork&source=rip_markdown&collection-url=entityId%3D9265903-7a75a0d0-b108-4436-ba54-c6139698dc08%26entityType%3Dcollection%26workspaceId%3Df507f69d-9564-419c-89a2-cb8e4c8c7b8f)

tags.name: Stations
tags.description:
Find and filter train stations across Europe, including their location
and local timezone.

tags.name: Trips
tags.description:
Timetables and routes for train trips between stations, including pricing
and availability.

tags.name: Bookings
tags.description:
Create and manage bookings for train trips, including passenger details
and optional extras.

tags.name: Payments
tags.description:
Pay for bookings using a card or bank account, and view payment
status and history.

> warn
> Bookings usually expire within 1 hour so you'll need to make your payment
> before the expiry date

get.summary: Get a list of train stations
get.description: Returns a paginated and searchable list of all train stations.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of items to return per page

parameters.name: coordinates
parameters.description: The latitude and longitude of the user's location, to narrow down the search results to sites within a proximity of this location.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: A search term to filter the list of stations by name or address.

Cache-Control.description:
The Cache-Control header communicates directives for caching mechanisms in both requests and responses. 
It is used to specify the caching directives in responses to prevent caches from storing sensitive information.

schema.description: A comma-separated list of directives as defined in [RFC 9111](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc9111.html).

RateLimit.description:
The RateLimit header communicates quota policies. It contains a `limit` to
convey the expiring limit, `remaining` to convey the remaining quota units,
and `reset` to convey the time window reset time.

allOf.description: This is a generic request/response wrapper which contains both data and links which serve as hypermedia controls (HATEOAS).

data.description: The wrapper for a collection is an array of objects.

links.description: A set of hypermedia links which serve as controls for the client.

country_code.description: The country code of the station.

timezone.description: The timezone of the station in the [IANA Time Zone Database format](https://www.iana.org/time-zones).

allOf.description: The link to the current resource.
Links to the next and previous pages of a paginated response.

RateLimit.description:
The RateLimit header communicates quota policies. It contains a `limit` to
convey the expiring limit, `remaining` to convey the remaining quota units,
and `reset` to convey the time window reset time.

schema.description: A problem detail object as defined in RFC 7807.

type.description: A URI reference that identifies the problem type

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type
examples: You do not have enough credit.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem
examples: Your current balance is 30, but that costs 50.

instance.description: A URI reference that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem

example.title: Bad Request
example.detail: The request is invalid or missing required parameters.

RateLimit.description:
The RateLimit header communicates quota policies. It contains a `limit` to
convey the expiring limit, `remaining` to convey the remaining quota units,
and `reset` to convey the time window reset time.

Retry-After.description:
The Retry-After header indicates how long the user agent should wait before making a follow-up request. 
The value is in seconds and can be an integer or a date in the future. 
If the value is an integer, it indicates the number of seconds to wait. 
If the value is a date, it indicates the time at which the user agent should make a follow-up request.

examples: Your current balance is 30, but that costs 50.

example.detail: You have exceeded the rate limit.

get.description: Returns a list of available train trips between the specified origin and destination stations on the given date, and allows for filtering by bicycle and dog allowances.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of items to return per page

parameters.name: origin
parameters.description: The ID of the origin station

parameters.name: destination
parameters.description: The ID of the destination station

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: The date and time of the trip in ISO 8601 format in origin station's timezone.

parameters.name: bicycles
parameters.description: Only return trips where bicycles are known to be allowed

parameters.name: dogs
parameters.description: Only return trips where dogs are known to be allowed

200.description: A list of available train trips

Cache-Control.description:
The Cache-Control header communicates directives for caching mechanisms in both requests and responses. 
It is used to specify the caching directives in responses to prevent caches from storing sensitive information.

schema.description: A comma-separated list of directives as defined in [RFC 9111](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc9111.html).

RateLimit.description:
The RateLimit header communicates quota policies. It contains a `limit` to
convey the expiring limit, `remaining` to convey the remaining quota units,
and `reset` to convey the time window reset time.

allOf.description: This is a generic request/response wrapper which contains both data and links which serve as hypermedia controls (HATEOAS).

data.description: The wrapper for a collection is an array of objects.

links.description: A set of hypermedia links which serve as controls for the client.

allOf.description: A train trip.

origin.description: The starting station of the trip

destination.description: The destination station of the trip

departure_time.description: The date and time when the trip departs

arrival_time.description: The date and time when the trip arrives

operator.description: The name of the operator of the trip

bicycles_allowed.description: Indicates whether bicycles are allowed on the trip

dogs_allowed.description: Indicates whether dogs are allowed on the trip

allOf.description: The link to the origin station resource.
The link to the destination station resource.
The link to the current resource.
Links to the next and previous pages of a paginated response.

get.description: Returns a list of all trip bookings by the authenticated user.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of items to return per page

parameters.name: bookingId
parameters.description: The ID of the booking to retrieve.

get.description: Returns the details of a specific booking.

Cache-Control.description:
The Cache-Control header communicates directives for caching mechanisms in both requests and responses. 
It is used to specify the caching directives in responses to prevent caches from storing sensitive information.

schema.description: A comma-separated list of directives as defined in [RFC 9111](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc9111.html).

and `reset` to convey the time window reset time.

parameters.name: bookingId
parameters.description: The ID of the booking to pay for.

post.description: A payment is an attempt to pay for the booking, which will confirm the booking for the user and enable them to get their tickets.

schema.description: A payment for a booking.

id.description: Unique identifier for the payment. This will be a unique identifier for the payment, and is used to reference the payment in other objects.

amount.description: Amount intended to be collected by this payment. A positive decimal figure describing the amount to be collected.

source.description: The payment source to take the payment from. This can be a card or a bank account. Some of these properties will be hidden on read to protect PII leaking.

oneOf.title: Card
oneOf.description: A card (debit or credit) to take payment from.

name.description: Cardholder's full name as it appears on the card.

number.description: The card number, as a string without any separators. On read all but the last four digits will be masked for security.

cvc.description: Card security code, 3 or 4 digits usually found on the back of the card.

exp_month.description: Two-digit number representing the card's expiration month.

exp_year.description: Four-digit number representing the card's expiration year.

oneOf.title: Bank Account
oneOf.description: A bank account to take payment from. Must be able to make payments in the currency specified in the payment.

number.description: The account number for the bank account, in string form. Must be a current account.

sort_code.description: The sort code for the bank account, in string form. Must be a six-digit number.

account_type.description: The type of entity that holds the account. This can be either `individual` or `company`.

bank_name.description: The name of the bank associated with the routing number.

status.description: The status of the payment, one of `pending`, `succeeded`, or `failed`.

Cache-Control.description:
The Cache-Control header communicates directives for caching mechanisms in both requests and responses. 
It is used to specify the caching directives in responses to prevent caches from storing sensitive information.

schema.description: A comma-separated list of directives as defined in [RFC 9111](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc9111.html).

RateLimit.description:
The RateLimit header communicates quota policies. It contains a `limit` to
convey the expiring limit, `remaining` to convey the remaining quota units,
and `reset` to convey the time window reset time.

allOf.description: A payment for a booking.

id.description: Unique identifier for the payment. This will be a unique identifier for the payment, and is used to reference the payment in other objects.

amount.description: Amount intended to be collected by this payment. A positive decimal figure describing the amount to be collected.

source.description: The payment source to take the payment from. This can be a card or a bank account. Some of these properties will be hidden on read to protect PII leaking.

oneOf.title: Card
oneOf.description: A card (debit or credit) to take payment from.

name.description: Cardholder's full name as it appears on the card.

number.description: The card number, as a string without any separators. On read all but the last four digits will be masked for security.

cvc.description: Card security code, 3 or 4 digits usually found on the back of the card.

exp_month.description: Two-digit number representing the card's expiration month.

exp_year.description: Four-digit number representing the card's expiration year.

oneOf.title: Bank Account
oneOf.description: A bank account to take payment from. Must be able to make payments in the currency specified in the payment.

number.description: The account number for the bank account, in string form. Must be a current account.

sort_code.description: The sort code for the bank account, in string form. Must be a six-digit number.

account_type.description: The type of entity that holds the account. This can be either `individual` or `company`.

bank_name.description: The name of the bank associated with the routing number.

status.description: The status of the payment, one of `pending`, `succeeded`, or `failed`.

links.description: The link to the booking resource.

The RateLimit header communicates quota policies. It contains a `limit` to
convey the expiring limit, `remaining` to convey the remaining quota units,
and `reset` to convey the time window reset time.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem
examples: Your current balance is 30, but that costs 50.

instance.description: A URI reference that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem

example.title: Too Many Requests
example.detail: You have exceeded the rate limit.

RateLimit.description:
The RateLimit header communicates quota policies. It contains a `limit` to
convey the expiring limit, `remaining` to convey the remaining quota units,
and `reset` to convey the time window reset time.

schema.description: A problem detail object as defined in RFC 7807.

type.description: A URI reference that identifies the problem type

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type
examples: You do not have enough credit.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem
examples: Your current balance is 30, but that costs 50.

instance.description: A URI reference that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem

example.title: Internal Server Error
example.detail: An unexpected error occurred.

post.description: Subscribe to new bookings being created, to update integrations for your users.  Related data is available via the links provided in the request.

allOf.description: A booking for a train trip.

has_bicycle.description: Indicates whether the passenger has a bicycle.

has_dog.description: Indicates whether the passenger has a dog.

allOf.description: The link to the current resource.
Links to the next and previous pages of a paginated response.

200.description: Return a 200 status to indicate that the data was received successfully.

limit.name: limit
limit.description: The number of items to return per page

OAuth2.description: OAuth 2.0 authorization code following RFC8725 best practices.

country_code.description: The country code of the station.

timezone.description: The timezone of the station in the [IANA Time Zone Database format](https://www.iana.org/time-zones).

Links-Self.description: The link to the current resource.

Links-Destination.description: The link to the destination station resource.

Links-Origin.description: The link to the origin station resource.

Links-Pagination.description: Links to the next and previous pages of a paginated response.

Problem.description: A problem detail object as defined in RFC 7807.

type.description: A URI reference that identifies the problem type

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type
examples: You do not have enough credit.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem
examples: Your current balance is 30, but that costs 50.

instance.description: A URI reference that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem

origin.description: The starting station of the trip

destination.description: The destination station of the trip

departure_time.description: The date and time when the trip departs

arrival_time.description: The date and time when the trip arrives

operator.description: The name of the operator of the trip

bicycles_allowed.description: Indicates whether bicycles are allowed on the trip

dogs_allowed.description: Indicates whether dogs are allowed on the trip

Booking.description: A booking for a train trip.

has_bicycle.description: Indicates whether the passenger has a bicycle.

has_dog.description: Indicates whether the passenger has a dog.

Wrapper-Collection.description: This is a generic request/response wrapper which contains both data and links which serve as hypermedia controls (HATEOAS).

data.description: The wrapper for a collection is an array of objects.

links.description: A set of hypermedia links which serve as controls for the client.

id.description: Unique identifier for the payment. This will be a unique identifier for the payment, and is used to reference the payment in other objects.

amount.description: Amount intended to be collected by this payment. A positive decimal figure describing the amount to be collected.

source.description: The payment source to take the payment from. This can be a card or a bank account. Some of these properties will be hidden on read to protect PII leaking.

oneOf.title: Card
oneOf.description: A card (debit or credit) to take payment from.

name.description: Cardholder's full name as it appears on the card.

number.description: The card number, as a string without any separators. On read all but the last four digits will be masked for security.

cvc.description: Card security code, 3 or 4 digits usually found on the back of the card.

exp_month.description: Two-digit number representing the card's expiration month.

exp_year.description: Four-digit number representing the card's expiration year.

oneOf.title: Bank Account
oneOf.description: A bank account to take payment from. Must be able to make payments in the currency specified in the payment.

number.description: The account number for the bank account, in string form. Must be a current account.

sort_code.description: The sort code for the bank account, in string form. Must be a six-digit number.

account_type.description: The type of entity that holds the account. This can be either `individual` or `company`.

bank_name.description: The name of the bank associated with the routing number.

status.description: The status of the payment, one of `pending`, `succeeded`, or `failed`.

Links-Booking.description: The link to the booking resource.

Cache-Control.description:
The Cache-Control header communicates directives for caching mechanisms in both requests and responses. 
It is used to specify the caching directives in responses to prevent caches from storing sensitive information.

schema.description: A comma-separated list of directives as defined in [RFC 9111](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc9111.html).

RateLimit.description:
The RateLimit header communicates quota policies. It contains a `limit` to
convey the expiring limit, `remaining` to convey the remaining quota units,
and `reset` to convey the time window reset time.

Retry-After.description:
The Retry-After header indicates how long the user agent should wait before making a follow-up request. 
The value is in seconds and can be an integer or a date in the future. 
If the value is an integer, it indicates the number of seconds to wait. 
If the value is a date, it indicates the time at which the user agent should make a follow-up request.
